title: Random act of kindness is sweet for visitors and patients at The Christie hospital in Manchester
text:

A kind-hearted stranger paid for vending machine treats at The Christie in Manchester and left a note explaining how they wanted to 'brighten up someone's day'. 
The poster was left on the machine on Sunday, inviting people to help themselves to the snacks. 
The note said: "Please find a variety of snacks in the bottom of this machine that have been paid for. I simply wanted to perform some random act of kindness to try and brighten up someone's day. Hopefully there will be something in there for you to enjoy. Finally, if you can, try and spread the kindness." Read More Jools Oliver launches 'My Rainbow Baby' Mothercare bodysuits 
Mum Kelly Carter is a nurse there and shared the image on her Facebook page. 
She said: " I'm a sister there. I didn't see it myself but a friend posted it. It's such a lovely thing to do." 
The Christie Hospital serves 3.2m people across Greater Manchester and Cheshire as well as patients referred from across the UK. The Christie NHS Foundation Trust (Photo: Mark Waugh) 
In November we reported how it had been rated as outstanding by health watchdogs .
